paper.title: Estimating trends in weather series: Consequences for pricing derivatives
paper.abstract: Predictions of future weather conditions play an important role in pricing weather derivatives. In many instances, the dates for which we require predictions are well beyond the point where physical forecasts have any skill. Under these circumstances, predictions are generated from statistical models of historic data. This paper derives conditions for which the predictive performance in regression is improved by ignoring or shrinking the contribution from some of the explanatory variables. We suggest methods for estimating the degree of shrinkage required in practice. We illustrate our methods using surface temperature data from fifteen stations in the United States.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是改进统计模型以预测未来天气条件，并明确指出这些预测在天气衍生品定价中起重要作用。因此，其主要应用领域是衍生品定价。
